ol.li: Load the input events from the lookup.
Transform the events to the input required by creategraphjson.
Run "| creategraphjson" on the input events to create the graph in your Neo4j instance.

div.p: Ensure the field json_obj is present and the json objects contain the required fields for nodes and rels. Please follow the example as guideline for field structure.
Either run your own search or select one of the example options below, to get a typical set of base events to work into the required nodes and relationsship format.
Once the search has run, select a source, destination and weight field to visualise the results.

div.button: Populate Search with a short movies graph

html.h1: 2. Transform fields to required json input
3. Execute |creategraphjson to create the graph on the Neo4j instance using json_obj
html.p: Append the following command to the SPL above ("Search results transformed"). You need to configured this app before and then provide the parameters for uri and account to the custom command:

pre.code: | creategraphjson uri=<my_uri_id> account=<my_account_id> inputfield=jsonobj propsprefix="p_" noact=f mode="merge"
